. It features the 3LT equipment group, an Arctic White finish, and Carbon Flash accents. Redesigning the Corvette for its eighth-generation, Chevrolet moved the 6.2L V8 engine to the middle of the car, just behind the seats. This gave the Corvette supercar powers by redistributing its weight resulting in a ratio of 40-percent front and 60-percent rear.

With 495-horsepower, an 8-speed transmission, and increased aerodynamics the

base model Corvette ever but this example isn’t your average base model ‘Vette. An electronic limited-slip differential, performance ratio rear axle, performance Brembo anti-lock brakes, and  performance suspension​ package are all included with the Z51 Performance Package. Chevrolet has delivered a faster and
that can accelerate, corner, and brake harder than ever before.
In addition to the new design's performance accomplishments,

also never looked so good. The contrast created by the Carbon Flash painted nacelles, Carbon Flash painted 5-open-spoke aluminum wheels, and Carbon Flash painted side vents is just the beginning as the sharper more defined body lines really bring the look together. That new found supercar style is continued to the cockpit where nearly everything is covered in black leather including the GT2 bucket seats. Thanks to the retractable hardtop, the roof can be raised or lowered at speeds up to 30-mph.

On top of winning a truly fantastic car, by entering into this raffle you’re helping a good charity. Ronald McDonald House Central Valley has been helping parents of sick patients stay close to their children since 1984. Your charitable donations benefit those in need and help to further the work of the Ronald McDonald House Central Valley. Oh and don’t forget to double your entries by entering the promo
